briefTitle: Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Randomised Withdrawal, Extension, Safety and Efficacy Study of LDX in Children and Adolescents Aged 6-17
officialTitle: A Phase III, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Randomised Withdrawal, Multicentre, Extension, Safety and Efficacy Study of Lisdexamfetamine Dimesylate (LDX) in Children and Adolescents Aged 6-17 With Attention- Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD)
summary: The main aim of this study is to evaluate the long-term maintenance of efficacy of LDX after administered to children and adolescents aged 6-17 with ADHD for at least 6 months

primaryOutcome.measure: Percent of Participants With Treatment Failures at End of The Randomized Withdrawal Period
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: Baseline of the randomized withdrawal period and its relevant endpoint (Up to 6 weeks)
